  38. JBCO was recommended to me by a friend who had used it and had great results. I ordered the product and immediately began using it. At first I thought it was great because it made my hair soft and moisturized (I was about eight months into my natural hair journey). About a week after using it, I noticed shedding but I thought it was due to it being Summer (my hair dries out in the Summer months). I continued to use it, ignoring the warnings. About a month later most of my hair had come out on the sides and in the back. I eventually had to chop my hair off because it was so uneven and damaged. After I stopped using it, the shedding stopped. My sister used the product and the same thing happened to her hair. We didn't put the two together until it it was too late. It may work for some but unfortunately it didn't work for me.

I haven't cut hair for 3 months now and am planning to keep it for some time. I bought JBCO with jasmine. I thought it would be black in color or something, but it was same colour as my existing castor oil. The only difference is that the castor oil I got from Indian store is much cheaper. Around 16oz bottle for 5$ or so compared to this JBCO. Indians use this for cooking, hair oil, baby massage, laxative etc. I would recommend going down to near by Indian store and buy castor oil bottle from there. I got \\"Laxmi\\" brand which I trust as I use other products from same brand. You will save 10$ or more for the same quantity. I found Indian castor oil to be a bit stickier. So I use coconut oil to make it more fluid. The only problem is that oil becomes solid and have to be put in hot water from tap for 2 to 3 minutes. I live in seattle where weather is pretty cold. Bottom line if you want to save some money walk down to a near by Indian store and buy castor oil from there. Much cheaper than JBCO or walgreens or local store near you.

Really takes my afro-textured locks to the next level by keeping them extra moisturized in the cold. It has amazing healing properties that address my dry, itchy scalp. I don't think I'll be using it as much in the summer unless I thin it out with grapeseed oil or jojoba oil, which I've done before. If you suffer with those nasty little 'fairy knots', this is a MUST-have to apply to your ends. It really does work to smooth out the cuticle and helps minimize the natural strands from curling into knots. Highly recommended for all hair types as it is natural, nurturing and just plain nice for our hair!

I have natural hair that is very course and somewhat fine in texture. I used to receive a lot of breakage and started to get frustrated because many products state that they are good for natural hair and promote healthy thick hair, but fail to do so. Immediately after applying this product to my scalp 3 times a week for the first 2 weeks along with coconut oil to my ends daily, I started to see a major difference in my hair. The new growth was much softer, my scalp was not dry, and my hair strands felt thicker/ stronger. I also noticed minimal breakage, if any, and not a lot of hair in my comb after combing my hair. I definitely recommend using this product sparingly since it is rather thick. It may be costly for some, but definitely worth the investment.   206. As a kid in Jamaica, my mom used to oil my hair with castor oil. It stunk then and it still stinks. The smell is because of the roasting of the seeds/beans. It's expensive in Jamaica too. After college, I vowed to really take care of my hair and I started using castor oil as a pre-poo steam treatment. When I can, I buy Jamaican castor oil because it what's I'm accustomed to. When I can't, I use the Home Health care brand which does not smell but is slightly less effective at softening my new growth. It can be itchy on the scalp if you have sensitive skin though- any castor oil, not just this brand. I mix this with Neem oil as a pre-poo treatment. My hair stinks temporarily but it looks great afterwards. Castor oil, multi-vitamin, weekly deep conditioning and relaxing every 12 weeks keeps my hair nice, thick and healthy.

  219. I am in love with this product! I purchased this item after reading about it in some hair care forums and also seeing various videos on youtube talking about how it promotes hair growth. This product is great for your hair and a little goes a long way. You only need to apply it to your scalp it is way to thick to put straight on your hair. After applying massaging your scalp will work some of the oil onto you hair. This stuff really works for growth. It is hard for me to see the growth in my own hair just because new growth can be hard to keep track of when you have a full head of hair. I know it works because my boy friend has been using it also. He suffers from partial baldness where he has a big spot in the back and his hairline has the way back v shapes. He has been applying 3 times a week for 2 weeks and massaging his scalp real good after, his hair is growing back. Its not supernatural growth but there was enough that his V shape in the front has filled in enough he had to get the barber to line up the fuzz ha! His family and friends have been making comments on his hair growth everyday! The best way I think to apply is get a bowl container with a top so you can pour a little of the oil in the bottom and dip your fingers tips in. Don't pour all your oil in the bowl because you will tend to cover your whole finger tip with oil and that is to much. If you have hair product containers that are about done wash one out and use it. It works for all races and hair types seems to me a person would only need to adjust the amounts or how often you wash depending on your hair type. Some reviews on the net are not happy about the smell, but It doesn't bother me at all. Search the net there are some things you can add to it to kill the smell or make your own mix for what ever purpose you please! There are a lot of uses for Castor Oil. This is a must have!

And it recommends their JBCO pomade (and I don't even have it.) It took me about 3 1/2 hours to do everything. I was thorough for my first time around.<br /><br />I haven't seen my hair this shiny since I was in my teens and soft.   228. I'm caucasion with long, straight, color treated hair that usually stays soft and healthy thanks to good conditioner. After some research, I thought I'd give castor oil a try even though I couldn't find much about using it for my hair type. I chose this brand because it seemed like good stuff. I applied it to the ends, the lengths, then massaged a little on my scalp and left it on for a few hours. Then I shampood it (took three times), conditioned it, and let it dry. It took 3 days for the stuff to get completely out of my hair but only I could tell that it was a little greasy...to others it just looked like I had product in and it didn't rub off on my pillow. Afterwards, my hair was back to being soft, shiny and sleek again! Now I always use this as a treatment a few days after I have my hair colored. I love it! I also use it for dry spots on my skin...I have a spot on my brow bone that gets so dry it looks flaky underneath eyeshadow and any time this flares up I just apply a tiny bit of oil for a couple days and it goes smooth and soft again. It works much better and is much cheaper than all the different expensive skin creams and hair treatments I've tried!

I would suggest, to those with acne prone skin to wear something to cover your head while sleeping to contain the oil and stop it from spreading to your pillow and face. My skin broke out like crazy.<br /><br />Maybe this product just didn't work for me but I will never ever purchase this product ever again.   311. I haven't seen any results with this product. I've read that women would put this on their eyelashes. I applied it once one night before bed and the following day I was sent home from work. I think the oil got into my eyes and irritated it. I remember my eyes being swollen and one of my eyes was swollen shut. Tears kept following from both my eyes and I've went slightly blind. It was tender to the touch and no matter how often I washed my eyes in the morning, it still didn't improve anything.<br />I went to the Eye doctor and the doctor couldn't do anything for me. I didn't want to go to ER as I didn't have any medical insurance. My last resort was to self-treat whatever was going on with me. I took a couple of Benadryl, and 5 hours later I woke up from a long nap and I could see that the swelling went down. I took more Benadryl at bedtime and woke up the following morning feeling much better. I was able to go back to work.<br /><br />I don't use the product since that last incident with my eyelashes. I guess I'm allergic to the oil. So I won't be using it anymore.

  323. After abusing my hair with perms, dye and glued-in weave, I decided to grow my OWN hair out. I've always felt that as long as there was weave in this world, I could always have long hair. Lol. I have very fine hair and it is relatively thin (which Im sure has a lot to do with the heat, perms and glue over the past two years). Over the past 5 months, my hair has DRAMATICALLY increased in thickness and moisture. I do not use black product shampoo because it knots my hair for some reason, but after I wash my hair and straighten it, I part it, and use JBCO. I massage it in my head once a day and also take a daily vitamin e pill. It has truly brought my hair back!

NOTHING I mean NOTHING moisturizes my hair like this castor oil. I thought that I would just have to deal with my dry brittle ends but JBCO has been my saving grace. My hair is soft and manageable my curls are defined not frizzy like before. One draw back, like I have seen with other reviewers, my scalp is irritated by this product so I use it to seal my ends or do a hot oil treatment, both of which nourishes my hair but keeps the product away from my scalp. Also it smells like grill or stove smoke so you may want to add it to leave in conditioner or essential oils. Overall I still give it 5 stars due to its miracle ability to moisturize and soften my hair, I wish I would have known about this years ago!

  335. I was skeptical as always when trying something new but I prefer to try products that are natural. I am african-american with natural 4B hair. My hairline was thinning due having my hair bleached & then dyed in July and the thinning was very noticeable. I bought this product & within in three weeks my hairline is growing back in beautifully. I can't speak for others but it has worked for me. Usually I wash/condition my hair and then oil my entire scalp with the castor oil. It is very thick & a little goes a long way. On my wash day I wear a plastic bag on my head over night to seal the moisture in (otherwise known as the greenhouse effect). Then I usually just put the castor oil around my thinning hair line daily. Funny thing is I have what I consider an unusual hairline where it dips back near my right/left temples and hair has started to grow in that area as well! I have never put the castor oil all over my hair b/c I dont see the need to do that. As for the scent, I personally dont mind the scent & I have a very sensitive nose. It does have the scent of ashes however I also use another moisturizer on my actual hair that has the scent of fresh baked pound cake/cookies and all I ever smell is that. If you have ever used shea butter, jojoba oil, etc you probably wont mind the scent of the castor oil. Overall I am pleased with the product and will continue to use this product even when my hairline has grown all the way in. As with all products I believe that no one product produces a miracle and you must be patient and have a regimn. I wanted my hairline to grow back so I am being very deligent about how I use the product. :)

  340. I regularly use castor oil for both akin and hair care, so when I saw this product on Amazon, I was very excited. Castor oil, but better, less processed, I thought.<br /><br />Being that this product is marketed as 'black castor oil', I was expecting an oil that is substantially thicker than regular castor oil and very dark. It's neither. It's got the same viscosity as regular castor oil and is far from 'black'. Is it a good product? As I have extensive experience using castor oil, I expect it to be pretty much the same. However, we will see if it works any better over the next couple of months. I've got fairly fine 'white girl' hair with a dry scalp. I've found that castor oil keeps my hair in much better condition that it normally would be in and keeps my scalp normal & flake free. The best thing I've found to do with castor oil is to massage it into my scalp and saturate my hair with it. I leave it in overnight, roll it up in a bun and hold it in place with the Goody twist pins. The next day I wash it out with sulfate free shampoo and condition with Ion conditioner. I will continue to do this with this product and see if it works any better than the castor oil I buy from my supplier which is totally clear with no color to it. This one is slightly tan in color, but still clear.<br /><br />The packing of the product is great. The bottle itself is dark glass, which protects the oil from light. Very important, so I was happy to see this. The labeling is clear and easy to read.

It has the consistent of a syrup or molasses so don't go crazy like you would with a lighter oil you'll end up with some seriously greasy hair. Also, do not be alarmed by the smell it's kinda smoky smelling almost smells like nuts being roasted in the oven once you put a moisturizer and water on it the smell disappears immediately. I use this every night and morning. It can also be used as a hot oil treatment. I'm really hoping that this product can grow my hair out because it grows very slowly and is kinda damaged. Since using this oil, for the first time ever of being 11 years natural, I am truly enjoying growing out my natural hair. My hair feels like someone else's hair: full, voluptuous and full of sheen. This oil will thicken your hair; however, I have found that it does not permanently thickens my hair. It seems that the oil itself is so thick that upon application it seems to instantly thickens hair. But if I were to wash my hair and not use, my hair is back to the thin soft wimpy fro again. I give it five stars due to my hair loves this stuff and it is impossible for me to get a good hair day without it.

Just remember, a little goes a long way - there're plenty of hints 'n tips on YouTube if you're unsure how and when to apply but basically if you're in two minds give it a try - for this price even if you find it's not for you i'd say it's definitely worth the gamble.

  555. BLACK CASTOR OIL WAS AN ESSENTIAL PART OF OUR HAIR CARE REGIME GROWING UP IN JAMAICA......GRANDMOTHERS, MOTHERS ECT WOULD MAKE BATCHES OF IT, THE SMELL WAS VERY PUNGENT BACK THEN TO THE POINT OF EMBARRASSMENT......BUT IT WAS LIKE GOLD TO OUR HAIR. MUCH SINCE LIVING IN THE U.S. (YRS NOW) CAUSE I FIGURED I MIGHT NOT GET THE REAL THING......WELL THIS BRAND SEEMS GREAT......THE SMELL IS LESS NOTICEABLE BUT MY 4C/4B HAIR FEELS LIKE BUTTER WHEN I APPLIED TO MY HAIR THIS PAST (4TH JULY) I DEEP CONDITION MY HAIR ADDED SOME ESSENTIAL OILS & CONDITIONER THEN STEAMED MY HAIR, RINSE & THEN ADDED THE CASTOR OIL TO MY LEAVE-IN CONDITIONER, MY HAIR LOOKED HEALTHY, IT WAS SOFT & QUITE MANAGEABLE, HAVEN'T HAD SUCH LUXURY IN YRS. LOVE IT WILL KEEP PURCHASING THAT BLACK GOLD.

And, neither does its scent linger in the hair for a very long period of time either.<br /><br />My special way of using this product is as a pre-treatment before I cleanse my hair. I apply it to both my hair and scalp either alone or mixed with either coconut or olive oil in an applicator bottle. Next, I put a plastic cap over my head. I keep the oil in for 1 hour in my hair. And, after such time is up, I then proceed to cleanse my hair thoroughy with my cleansing conditioner of choice.<br /><br />I actually have very sensitive skin and I have not experienced any bad reactions (itching, burning, rash, etc.) to this product at all. It has really helped to make my hair feel softer, look shinier, and gain increased health to it overall. Also, it has really helped to alleviate my issues with having a dry scalp.   704. I was hesitant to try this oil because of the price and reviewers who complained of odor. I still think the price is too high. As for the odor, it's not really an odor, more of a strong woodsy smell. It reminds me of burning wood (the smell you get after lighting a match). The smell is not over-powering, but it is present. I added a few drops of peppermint essential oil to neutralize it a bit.<br /><br />This castor oil did make my hair extremely soft, though! I have thick coarse natural hair that has a lot of shrinkage when wet. My hair also tangles easily. I washed, conditioned, and detangled my hair then applied just a tiny amount of oil while doing two strand twists. I focused mainly on my ends. (This oil is extremely thick. You only need a very small amount.) I couldn't see any difference while my hair was wet. But the next day when it dried, it was so luxuriously soft. My twists had a lightness and sheen that I've never had before.<br /><br />Two weeks after that one wash and application, the same luster, softness, and sheen are still present. Overall very happy with this product! Just wish it were less expensive.

I have now been using this oil for about a month along with biotin to get my hair to grow. I apply only to my scalp (I find it spreads easier when my hair is damp and I use less oil).   944. For starters, I was extremely excited when my online search for a product to help thicken hair, fill in thin spots, and grow hair quickly, led me to Jamaican Black Castor Oil. After breathing a sigh of relief and ordering on Amazon, I waited, impatiently, for the product to be delivered. Upon arrival, I dashed in the house to apply Jamaican Black Castor Oil to my hair. \\"The sooner I start treating my hair,\\" I thought, \\"the faster the results.\\" Upon opening the bottle, I immediately noticed the woodsy smell. \\"So, the smell is a little outdoorsy. If all the hype, accolades, and testimonies are true, it'll be well worth it. And, it's a small price to pay for miraculous results.\\" Little did I know, the price would be extensively beyond what I could afford or was willing to pay. Well, after about one week into using the product, I noticed my head itched profusely especially in the areas where I applied extra for more bountiful results, a top spot in my head where my hair was thin. \\"Itching? That's good, right? Oh yeah! It's definitely working! I mean, my leg muscles itch after a strenuous workout. And, the results are always positive.\\" Not so. About after week two, my natural but course hair, which I love, was smooth to the touch, and easier to manage. It was so smooth I couldn't stop touching it, especially in the top spot which was thin. But as I fingered through my now smooth hair, I noticed my hair appeared to be shedding. I thought, \\"It's just a part of the natural shedding that hair does daily.\\" Wrong again! Well into the end of week three, the thin section in the top of my head felt extremely thin. So, I decide to take a look and see exactly what was happening up there. Much to my astonishment, what I saw was nothing! My once THIN spot was now a BALD spot. The Jamaican Black Castor Oil had caused my hair in that section to break off, leaving a bald spot. Now, it wasn't baby's bottom smooth bald. But, it appeared as though someone had given me a buzz cut in this one spot alone. Long story short, I'm now resigned to wearing baseball caps and head wraps until the spot in my hair grows back. Everything that glitters ain't gold.

  953. As my title suggests, I love this product. It is great for both relaxed and natural people when used to moisturize hair and seal the ends. I found great benefits from pouring it in my hands and then running my hands through my relaxed hair. My hair would always end up super soft and luxurious feeling no matter what other shampoo or conditioner I used with it. I have found similar results after going natural but not as dramatic as when I was relaxed.<br /><br />I think where some people run into trouble is when they apply this product directly to their scalp. I would strongly advise against that. I do not have a sensitive scalp but when I placed this product on my scalp, I experienced terrible itching and raised bumps all over my head. Further research showed that others also experienced this. The itching and the bumps did not go away after one wash. It took maybe two washes for the symptoms to subside. I did, however and unfortunately, notice more growth around my edges where I was using the product on my scalp. I just felt in the end that the pain was not worth it. If you really want to try it on your scalp (because I do know at least one person for whom this product did not cause a negative reaction), I would use the spot treatment method. Apply it to one spot on your scalp and note if you feel any different. Then wait until the next morning before trying it elsewhere on your scalp. I always felt it by the morning.<br /><br />With regard to nature of the product itself, firstly, it does not have a strong smell. It's a bit musky and smells like something a man would wear but that smell goes away very quickly. I am very sensitive to product odors so this really would have bothered me if it was really bad. In addition, the oil is very thick and it is almost clear in appearance.<br /><br />Despite my negative reaction to it when using it directly on my scalp, I will keep using it because it is a great moisturizer for my hair strands. And though I will not use it onmy scalp, I acknowledge that it may work for others who are not sensitive to it. Good luck!

  1052. I have actually brought this oil about 3 months ago, but decided to wait to post my review to see how this product works. I have been transitioning for 9 months now, going from relaxed hair to natural. My hair type is 3c-4a. This oil is thick and a little goes a long way. My hair has become damaged from years of relaxing. My hair has broken off at my edges and also my hair began thinning on the top of my head.( near the middle of my head) I even had a bald spot on the side of my head which was there since I was a teenager. (pulling my hair back a lot using banana clips caused the bald spot) Since I have been using this oil my hair is growing back in my bald spot, my edges and the top of my head! This oil really works. It has also enriched the color of my hair and provides excellent moisture when used as a hot oil treatment; which I do once a week. I put the oil on my scalp every night and massage it into my scalp, then I twist my hair in two strands and wear a satin scarf to bed. In the morning I untwist my hair and have the most beautiful soft curls. It also keeps my new growth soft while I am transitioning from the relaxer. I need to say however that the smell is not very pleasant. It smells like ashes but the smell does not stay in your hair. The oil and the smell are quickly absorbed. To take the smell down a little I mix this oil with coconut oil or jojoba oil in a separate applicator squeeze bottle before applying to my scalp. This oil is also great in sealing the ends of your hair also.

  1199. This item shipped quickly, I was about to run out. If you've never used it, this is a darker version to what most of us know castor oil to look like. It is not actually &#34;black&#34; as the name implies its more of an olive green/brown mix. The bottle is actually darker than the actual product. Its slightly thicker than the drug store kind but has no real smell. Its far better than the stuff I had to hold my nose around as a kid. Makes a wonderful addition to my winter oil mix (I feel its too thick to use alone). Adds wonderful moisture to skin and some hair types. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone with straight hair or if your prone to oily build up. Pros: much larger than drug store brands, much thicker than some of the ones found in larger bottles, leaves hair and skin moisturized. Mixed with other oils will thin it out. Cons: Some may not like the slightly thick consistency

  1235. I received the product very timely, almost too quickly...:O) When I first read about the benefits of JBCO, out of impatience, I drove the same day to a local beauty supply and bought a small bottle (a no-name brand ...lol. Had I known the Amazon shipment would be so quick, I might have waited)...But I digress.. So, I'm nearly out of the no-name brand and will begin this product shortly. (Hence the 4 stars versus 5). MY RESULTS: My edges were never really bad, but due to years of wig-wearing my hairline had become somewhat thin. That was my original reason for using the JBCO. And I have noticed a difference already. At 2 places near my left and right temples, the hair which was noticeably thinner is now filling in. Yay! I told a friend about it. She used it on her daughter's edges and they have now filled in as well! PLEASE KNOW: For those of you ladies who continue to lose hair despite using JBCO, you might also look into OTHER POTENTIAL REASONS. A few years ago, my hair just started coming out. Not breaking out, COMING OUT, as I have always had lots of long, thick hair (I mostly wear wigs for variety of style and color). Thank the Lord, my hair also grows fast, otherwise with the amount I lost, I'd have been bald in not time...:O( Just touching my hair, I would have swatches of my hair in my hand. Because I had just reached a 'milestone birthday,' I attributed it to the natural progression of age. During a routine annual physical, however, I finally learned I was anemic. I believe this contributed to my hair loss. For as soon as I began iron supplements and reversed the anemia, my hair stopped coming out. Also, hormonal imbalances (especially thyroid imbalance) will definitely cause you to lose hair. (BTW, if you don't eat iodized salt or take kelp or seaweed supplements, your iodine intake may be too low. Low iodine negatively affects your thyroid). So, before you give up, have your doctor or nutritionist check for these common issues we women have. All the oil in the world won't undo the effects of an imbalance in the body. Believe me, I know. Being someone who would've tried everything on the market to stop my hair from falling out, I can honestly say JBCO would not have worked on me until I corrected the blood anemia. Hope this helps those who haven't been able to find the answer otherwise. Blessings!

  1304. I never take the time to write a review but I always read them before purchasing anything. However after using the BJCO I just had to write a review. About 7 years ago I got lashes for the first time for a wedding. I wasn’t sure if I was allergic to the glue or if it was the way I removed them but I pretty much lost all of my lashes. They were short, paper thin and in 7 years they never grew back. So about a month ago I decided to go natural and I was researching products that would help my thick course hair and I came across BJCO. I received the product on 11/29 and used it immediately. I didn't use it on my hair (which is what I initially purchased it for) but I used it on my lashes every night before bedtime. The product is very thick and smells like cigarette ashes but it is AMAZING. It has been 2 days shy of a month and I now have lashes again! I didn't achieve this amount of growth in the 7 years after I took them off. I then told my husband about this product and convinced him to let me use it on his thinning balding hair. OMG his hair is starting to grow in the spot where there hasn't been any hair for years. He and I both are truly amazed at this product and we swear by it. If you can get past the smell I think you will be truly amazed at what this product does. I have and will continue to recommend this product.
  1305. This oil is thick and nourishing. It has almost no smell. I think that it will do wonders for my dry hair and scalp.
  1306. Everyone gives this great reviews but so far, my personal experience hasn't been phenomenal. I had locks for 18yrs. I'm currently in my late 30s. I don't have a receding hair line but after cutting my locks, there were spots left with very little follicle. I blame the constant twisting, as I got my hair done weekly to bi-weekly. I've been using it for 4 months and the proces is extremely slow. I see improvement but have not yet fixed the issue. I haven't finished the bottle. I use a small dab once, daily after a shower. Patiently waiting to see how long it will take to heal.<br /><br />Update: 4 years later.<br />I have not consistently used this product. Only purchased 2 bottles since I've cut my locks. Spot are still there and have seen a small improvement. I will attempt to use it twice a day for the next few months and report on any improvement.
  1307. Very thick and smells horrible. I've been using it on my hair for three months and didn't notice any difference in the softness or thickness of hair.   1315. I have been applying this to my scalp 1-2x/week for &#62;1 year. Doesn't instantly &#34;regrow hair&#34; (and I know because I have some central balding); but it does help and I think with some biotin forte (taken orally daily), would probably help a lot more. Keeps scalp moisturized, and I have actually noticed reduction in hair shedding/hair loss since using this; bald spot looks a lot fuller, but not &#34;back to normal&#34;; however, balding has not progressed since I started using this. I haven't been taking oral biotin, but intend to start again in 1-2 years. Just remember to apply very little, or you might experience some scalp irritation/itching. Overall, would purchase again (gone through 2-3 bottles so far).

However it is great as a moisturizer/sealant for the hair. I just take a quarter sized dab and massage it into my hair before wrapping it at night twice a week or so, and it gives it that sleek, shiny healthy look and make it thicker. It absorbs quickly and surprisingly doesn't weigh the hair down like most other oils. Great for girls with thin/fine hair!

  1329. Well I have heard alot of good reviews about this product and so far I am not that impressed yet(it's ok but I like it at the same time so far...First ill get to the negative of this product, the consistancy is not like other castor oils...I have read the reviews on this oil and from the reviews I had the impression that this castor oil was just too thick(thats what I like thick oil to seal the ends of my hair) but this oil is a bit watery compared to other brands of castor oils that I have used. And because this castor oil is not thick enough for me to seal my ends I had to purchase another brand to do the job. Now the positive so far is: I actually like the smell of this oil, I know that some people who reviewed this product did't care for the smell but it smells good, it smells like roasted coffe beans..lol..but the smell does not linger so thats a plus as well. another positive that I like about this oil is that once I applied the oil to my scalp my scalp started to tingle..I was not expecting for this oil to give my scalp a nice tingling sensation..Now myself I am a big fan of tingling sensations on my scalp, it lets me know that somthing is going on...Most growth aides that I use have a tingling sensation(but this castor oil has my scalp tingling more than any other growth aid I have ever used, the tingling last for 15- 45 min..other growth aides last 2-5 min) and everytime I get the tingles a month later my hair sprouts with crazy growth...Now I am not sure if that tingling sensation that I am getting from this product means a month later ill have crazy growth but from past experiances with other growth aids(which has managed to aide in giving me growth to the point of achieving bra stap length afro textured hair) the tingling sensation usually means that I have purchased a damn good growth aide...So I am going to have to come back and do an update within a month or two if this product has givin me crazy growth...But so far the tingling is a plus..Another positive is that this oil alone makes my hair supper soft....it's rare that a oil alone can make my curley, kinky, wavy hair so soft(besides my coconut oil)...So the positives out way the negatives so far but I really didn't want to buy another castor oil after spending money on this item which is more expensive then other brands of castor oils. Now if I don't get crazy growth from this oil then ill add that to my negative list ...as far as this item making my hair soft well my coconut oil does that as well...So basically when I update my review on this poduct in about a month or two maybe three, it will be about rather or not this item has givin me crazy results or some good growth results and if my hair has thickned up alot.<br /><br />UPDATE: OK it's been a month almost and this item does work very well, but here is the catch.....I also use BEE MINE sulfur serum with this oil and my hair has grown alot and has thickened up...so I will purchase this castor oil to work with my sulfur serum.....So this is a good product.itive is that this oil alone makes my hair supper soft....it's rare that a oil alone can make my curley, kinky, wavy hair so soft(besides my coconut oil)...So the positives out way the negatives so far but I really didn't want to buy another castor oil after spending money on this item which is more expensive then other brands of castor oils.   1341. I ordered this product I think a week ago. I just started using it a few days ago. I tend to not use shampoo on my hair because ALL shampoos are very drying and it leaves my hair EXTREMELY dry, matted, and it breaks off. I have very curly (looks like ring curls) AA hair. Some weeks ago I decided for the first time ever to get my hair braided and it was hard for me to wash my hair every week like i'm used to. I finally took out my braids and washed my hair with Pantene. I figured I needed shampoo badly because my scalp was super itchy from the weave and I knew my hair wasn't getting cleaned the way I wanted it to while I had the braids. Needless to say the Pantene left my hair so dry and mangled to my head that I wanted to cry!!! My curls had completely tangled all over my head. Well, I took an empty spray bottle I had lying around and mixed Almond Oil, Castor Oil, Water and a little bit of the Knot today Leave in Conditioner created by Kinky Curly hair care. And all I can say is way! I was able to rub the mixture into my hair so well and I could just feel it working! I was able to comb through my hair with no problems or breakage. I know for a fact that It had to have been the Castor Oil because NOT KNOCKING KINKY CURLY but the leave in has NEVER detangled my hair. I just got it because I needed an all natural leave in. I believe it was the Castor Oil working with the Sweet Almond Oil. And GET THIS, I've been washing my face with nothing but CASTOR OIL. YES CASTOR OIL. I wet my face with warm water to open my pores and remove some makeup, then I apply a teaspoon of CO to my face and rub it in GOOOOOOD! It removes my makeup perfectly. After I've rubbed it in, I take my warm, wet face towel and wipe away the oil (I always clean my towel out with soap afterwards). Everyday my face looks healthier and it's only been a few days with nothing but water and castor oil. I apply a little bit to my face and eyelashes at night. You won't believe this but my stubby lashes are getting longer and thicker. I can't believe it... I'm honestly stunned by the beauty effects of CO. It doesn't smell lovely buy damn it works wonders!!

  1348. Let me start by saying I have slow growing hair. Now. I had a spot on the top of my head where my hair was VERY thin and noticeably shorter than the rest of my hair, even with close cuts. I'd been trying to get that spot (about the size of a US $.50 coin) to grow for YEARS! As a matter of fact, it was the reason why I did the big chop back in 2000. So for literally 12+ years, I struggled with that one spot. Back in March of this year, I'd just come to the conclusion that I would keep my hair cut SUPER close just to keep that spot camouflaged. Then someone suggested this product. Honestly, I rolled my eyes, because I'd tried almost EVERYTHING, different hair pomades, coconut oil, olive oil, hot oil treatments, various shampoos, braids (to give it a rest) this product, that product, the other product - including regular castor oil, and nothing had worked. Nonetheless, I figured, what the hey . . . I'll try it as a last ditch effort.<br /><br />Once received, I'd dip my finger in the bottle and rub the oil into the area 2-3 times a week as suggested, which worked perfectly for me since I rarely use any one product consistently on a daily basis. At the time, my hair surrounding the spot was already longer than the hair in that area, so I cut it all off (super close) to get all my hair on the same playing field - so the spot wouldn't have to play catch up. In two weeks time, I could see that the spot was growing better than it had before, however, it was still lagging behind the rest of my hair, so I did one more super close cut, but kept applying the oil. That was in April. Since that time, my hair in that spot has completely filled in and was (and still is) growing at the same rate as the hair on the rest of my head. I haven't had to cut it to try to hide that spot anymore.<br /><br />My hair still doesn't grow as fast as I'd like it to, but it is thicker and more full than it has EVER been in the past 12 years. And there are NO almost-bald spots.<br /><br />Because it only takes a \\"dip\\" of oil, I am still on my first bottle.

  1366. Castor oil is a must have product in black households for the hair. I have been using castor oil since my days in Jamaica. It was one of the staple products that women in the countrysides of Jamaica use in their hair to treat it before and after a relaxer. A lot of people now think its strong but believe me growing up it was much stronger, i guess because it was done in a more natural way. It was so strong that i would smell it it in peoples hair the day after their relaxer lol. I never saw women with damage hair back then just a head full of thick healthy hair, so the smell does not bother me, as matter of fact whenever i smell castor oil I automatically think healthy thick hair, I kid you not. Castor oil can be found in Haiti, Trinidad and other countries. Because Jamaicans traditionally use castor oil as a hair treatment, thats why its call Jamaican castor oil but other countries has it aslo.
  1367. The contents of this is just like what I remember Castor Oil was in Jamaica. I love it and it amazing on my hair. Helps to leave my hair soft and shinny. I'm now mixing this with coconut oil.   1415. This oil has so many uses - but I use this on my scalp. This is wonderful for hair growth and strengthening plus it's a great moisturizer! Just rub this on the scalp a couple of times a day and you will be AMAZED! This oil is thick and not runny, if you don’t like the smell or thickness you can mix with other carrier oils.<br /><br />I had a severe hair loss issue and using this oil helped me grow my hair back in a couple of months! Consistency is the KEY! I LOVE it and would highly recommend it to anyone. If you find yourself getting bumps on your scalp, undiluted may be too strong for you. Simply mix other olive, jojoba or another oil to ease the sensitivity.<br /><br />I have used NUMEROUS brands of Regular Castor and Black Castor Oil - just look for 100% or pure and you can't go wrong with either type or brand. I have indeed posted reviews on different brands because I have used these brands. I use castor oil on my hair and my daughters’ hair and I mix my own hair products so I buy several brands as long as they are 100% / pure castor. I hope this review helps!!

  1490. I had actually been using the NOW Brand of castor oil with great success before switching to this brand after I ran out. I made the switch based on this having just as glowing reviews as NOW Brand (but slightly more of them) and this being heavily endorsed on many black hair care discussion forums.<br /><br />I am glad this works so well for others but my hair hated this and rebelled against me. I started shedding like crazy after continued use. A problem I never, ever experienced with NOW. I could kick myself for not putting 2 and 2 together and not realizing this was what was causing my excessive shedding. It wasn't until after a stopped using it and the shedding came to a standstill and then I picked up this bottle and starting using it and the shedding came back in full force did I realize this was the culprit. Unfortunately, I had already lost about 1/3 or more of my hair's thickness by than. Another thing I noticed about this product is that it has some impurities to it. Maybe that is what causes it to be black? I always put my castor oil in a thin tipped dispenser bottle usually used for color application, which makes it super easy to apply. Anyway, I noticed that there would be some black sediment at the bottom of the bottle. Yuck!<br /><br />This experience did teach me that everything ain't for everybody. I am glad it works for so many. I am just not one of them.

  1502. I got this to try on my eyebrows and lashes after being scared straight away from Latisse. I have been using it for about 90 days, and - IT WORKS. My eyebrows have filled in and my lashes are.. !! Not much thicker but I would say almost twice as long as they were, especially the bottom ones - ! I don't need to use eyeliner anymore, and not much mascara either. Latisse is, what? $125 and can cause severe irritation and - can actually cause brown specs and changes to your eye color?! THIS castor oil (I cannot vouch for any other brand) will last for the rest of my life, probably - I apply it with a small filbert artist's brush to the base of my lashes and to my eyebrows, and dab off the excess with a tissue before bed. Took maybe a month to really start seeing a change but now - I cannot believe the difference! It almost looks ridiculous to put mascara on now - over the top, but my lashes are pale so I need the color. Don't waste your money or risk your eye health on Latisse - this is a tiny fraction of the cost, it's natural, and it really, really works. Make sure you get the kind with NO SALT.

I've heard this product works nothing but miracles but I would not recommend you make your purchase of this product on Amazon. This oil was too thick and heavy on my fragile hair so when I applied it and massaged it through I it would leave hairs tangled in my fingers. I even tried mixing it with a lighter oils like coconut to thin out the thickness in the castor oil. It made np difference. I left it on over night about two three times and the morning after I felt that half my hair came out. This scared me to death so I am no longer using it. The only positive I've seen was that it made my hair longer faster, but I was looking for thickness not length. I'm extremely disappointed because this was my last hope.
  1549. Yes I love it, so far so good, as a Jamaican myself I know castor oil 8s good for the hair so I will continue to buy it and use it
  1550. After reading all the reviews for this product, I decided to make the purchase. I started using this product one month ago, I use it for scalp massages and to seal the ends of my hair. Please note that if you have fine hair, this product will make your hair feel thick and full, as for growth I haven't noticed any. This product when used in small amounts is good for helping you retain your length when using it to seal the ends of your hair. I had great results mixing the JBCO with my regular conditioner and 30 minutes under heatcap, its really coats and softens when used as a deep conditioner. Warning do not get heavy handed with this product, your hair will be SUPER greasy and weighed down. All in all, okay product, JBCO is an heavy oil and has protected my hair against the harsh winter cold.

  1552. Haven't noticed extreme results yet but I'm keeping hope alive.

  1564. I kept reading reviews and watching natural hair care videos and of course this product kept coming up so I eventually decided to try it. I never liked the drug store castor oil because it weighed my hair down. I am a black woman with natural hair living in the tropics and working in an air conditioned office all day and I find that this Black Castor oil does wonders for keeping my hair shiny and moisturized. I just lightly spritz some water and massage the oil throughout and it is perfect. It does have a bit of an ashy smell but that doesn't bother me any, that's the smell of goodness! and it isn't noticeable once you massage it into the hair, unless you probably use an unnecessary & ridiculous amount. Which is another thing that makes it so worth it; the fact that the 8 oz bottle will last and last, I've been using one bottle for 2 months now and it is just about a third of the way down so I know it will last for quite a while still and I got 3 bottles my first order so I'm set!
  1565. I mistakenly ordered this thinking it was a castor oil shampoo - oops! However, I still had a supply of my old castor oil shampoo ([[ASIN:B003KIU14O Tropic Isle Jamaican Black Castor Oil Shampoo, 8 Ounce]]) so I used this product for additional oil application. I am a mixed race woman (mistaken as Caucasian often) but my hair is baby fine and thinning really badly. Over the years I've been looking for a gentle shampoo and hair treatment to prevent further hair fall and breakage. Heard some good things about castor oil and figured I would give this a shot.<br /><br />This is oil, make no mistake about it. I applied some for the first time during a shower, and I was a little too liberal. My hair dried very greasy and nasty looking. However, with some care, I've taken to applying it with my current shampoo in roughly half/half and the results are nice. The Tropic Isle Shampoo is very strong and dries my hair very quickly (even though my hair and scalp is naturally oily). Adding the castor oil has helped to offset the shampoo and leaves my hair feeling very soft. It also helps combing my hair to be easier with the oil.<br /><br />That said, it is pretty costly, and the smell isn't a selling point. I don't have much of a problem with requiring scents in my hair care products, but this is no Herbal Essences. Be prepared to have an unusual oily smell when you use it.

I find the regular castor oil, cold compressed, to be better and does not cause the itching that I experienced with this product.
  1675. That is all. I believe it is making my edges come back in...slowly but surely. Will be ordering more shortly.
  1676. This product is great it does not take a lot of it to work in hair. I will say this stuff work miracles for my edges.
